keyword: how many calories in a tuna sandwich
title: How Many Calories in a Tuna Sandwich?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a tuna sandwich, including full nutrition breakdown, protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Tuna Sandwich?
assumptions: Standard recipe: 100g canned tuna in water (drained), 1 tbsp mayo, diced celery/onion, on 2 slices white bread; no extras like lettuce or cheese.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, bread type, mayo amount, and preparation. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical tuna sandwich contains about 350 kcal and 20 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use whole wheat bread instead of white

faqs.q: How many calories in a tuna sandwich with mayo?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard version with 1 tbsp mayo.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Roughly 20 g protein from the tuna and bread.

faqs.q: Does bread type affect calories in a tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Yesâ€”whole wheat reduces calories slightly vs. white bread.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Around 700 mg, mostly from canned tuna and bread.

faqs.q: Can I make a low-calorie tuna sandwich?
faqs.a: Use light mayo, skip extras, and opt for whole grain bread to cut ~50 kcal.
